text:
This is very annoying

My site uses mod_ssl but when a user uses proxies (eg. squid) - I cannot figure
out its real IP address

REMOTE_ADDR points to last proxy (I tested it on chain of 2 poxies),
and HTTP_X_FORWARDED_FOR is unset

so the user can do everything on my site without being noticed - all will go on
account of the last squid proxy

best regards
Lukasz Budnik
creator: xhemjl@tlen.pl

text:
Well, that's how proxies work. If the proxy doesn't send an X-Forwarded-For
header, HTTP_X_FORWARDED_FOR is unset, of course. That has nothing to do with
mod_ssl.
creator: nd@perlig.de
